title: Finding Peace When Life Feels Fragile
scriptureText: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear, though the earth give way and the mountains fall into the heart of the sea, though its waters roar and foam and the mountains quake with their surging.
intro: This morning in our El Paso community, we're reminded of how quickly life can change. Two people critically injured in a motorcycle collision. A pedestrian seriously hurt. In moments like these, we're confronted with the fragility of life.
body:
Life can change in an instant. The phone rings with unexpected news. The routine commute takes an unexpected turn. In these moments, we're reminded that we are not in control—and that can be terrifying.

But Scripture offers us a different perspective. The psalmist declares that even if the mountains fall into the sea, we need not fear. Why? Because God is not only our refuge—He is our strength. He is not distant—He is ever-present.

When we face the fragility of life, we have a choice: we can let fear consume us, or we can let faith ground us. Today, choose faith. Choose to trust that even when life feels unstable, God remains our unshakable foundation.

For those injured in our community today, we pray. For the families affected, we pray. And we remember that every day is a gift—not guaranteed, but entrusted to us by a loving God who walks with us through every valley.
reflection: What area of your life feels uncertain right now? How can you invite God to be your refuge in that space?
prayer: Lord, when life feels fragile and uncertain, remind me that You are my unshakable foundation. Be with those hurting in our community today. Help me trust in Your presence and be Your hands of comfort to others. In Jesus' name, Amen.
fullText:
Finding Peace When Life Feels Fragile

Psalm 46:1-3
'God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear, though the earth give way and the mountains fall into the heart of the sea...'

This morning in our El Paso community, we're reminded of how quickly life can change. Two people critically injured in a motorcycle collision. A pedestrian seriously hurt. In moments like these, we're confronted with the fragility of life.

Life can change in an instant. The phone rings with unexpected news. The routine commute takes an unexpected turn. In these moments, we're reminded that we are not in control—and that can be terrifying.

But Scripture offers us a different perspective. The psalmist declares that even if the mountains fall into the sea, we need not fear. Why? Because God is not only our refuge—He is our strength. He is not distant—He is ever-present.

When we face the fragility of life, we have a choice: we can let fear consume us, or we can let faith ground us. Today, choose faith. Choose to trust that even when life feels unstable, God remains our unshakable foundation.

For those injured in our community today, we pray. For the families affected, we pray. And we remember that every day is a gift—not guaranteed, but entrusted to us by a loving God who walks with us through every valley.

Reflection Question: What area of your life feels uncertain right now? How can you invite God to be your refuge in that space?

Prayer: Lord, when life feels fragile and uncertain, remind me that You are my unshakable foundation. Be with those hurting in our community today. Help me trust in Your presence and be Your hands of comfort to others. In Jesus' name, Amen.
